video.title: Overcoming obstacles when learning to code
video.description:
Find out tips for overcoming obstacles and lack of motivation when learning to code.

🔗Slides: https://github.com/robaxelsen/obstacles-talk

Talk by Robert Axelsen (@robaxelsen) at the FreeCodeCamp Vienna February meetup.

Recorded by Pusher.com. Check them out if you want awesome real-time tools, and subscribe to the their YouTube channel for more talks!

Pusher's channel: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCoyqucxoFXDFnh3khD0rjUg

--

Learn to code for free and get a developer job: https://www.freecodecamp.org

Read hundreds of articles on programming: https://medium.freecodecamp.org

topLevelComment.author: iVuDang
topLevelComment.text: Thank you for sharing and the encouragement!

topLevelComment.author: Stef Joseph-Kruyswijk
topLevelComment.text: In 2018 people are apparently still looking down on other people that learn to code... I guess those people will be surprised when their jobs have been taken over by a bot or AI

topLevelComment.author: Helmi Ntug
topLevelComment.text: Thank you, for keep it my spirit to not stop to learn...

topLevelComment.author: Surendra Tamang
topLevelComment.text:
what they use  to 
make slides?

replies.author: freeCodeCamp.org
replies.text: reveal.js. Check out the code here: https://github.com/robaxelsen/obstacles-talk

topLevelComment.author: Booker DeWitt
topLevelComment.text:
I’ve learned so much over the years, I’ve gone through most of freecodecamp, done all courses on codecademy even did the web dev course on teamtreehouse.  

I just can’t get to the point where I am job ready. I have zero confidence in my skills outside of following along with courses and given assignments. I can’t make anything from scratch. It’s my dream to become a programmer but I’ve tried for years now and I just can’t get past this huge roadblock, I don’t know what to do now.

replies.author: Bajdo Bajdevski
replies.text:
Hello Booker... It's 2 years since you wrote this comment... How are things now?
I wish you all the best!

replies.author: Lord of the Jungle
replies.text: @Booker DeWitt - have you tried going back into your older projects and making changes like color, buttons etc?  It helps to get familiarity with coding

replies.author: Ashish Kumar
replies.text: Don''t lose hope brother. Try to learn them. This is an excellent sign that you are out of your comfort zone. So, Build your personal site without any hesitation that you will fail. Only if you fail,You will get to learn

replies.author: Miguel Alejandro Morales
replies.text: Booker DeWitt I have no degree in marketing... But I'm the marketing director at a fast-growing, very serious company.

topLevelComment.author: Robert Axelsen
topLevelComment.text:
Hi everyone, speaker here 👋😃 

Thanks a lot for watching, and feel free to ask me any questions here in the comments.

Here are the slides, and as I mentioned in the talk, feel free to contribute with any improvement or additional tips and helpful advice:
https://github.com/robaxelsen/obstacles-talk

replies.author: freeCodeCamp.org
replies.text: Thanks for the great talks and for organizing the meetup! I just added your slides to the description. If you know of any other good talks that we should post, send them to me. beau@freecodecamp.org.

topLevelComment.author: Nan jayo
topLevelComment.text: Free code camp I would love love more women teachers from you

replies.author: lalaithan
replies.text: Thanks, I was looking for some myself. I wonder it must be nice up there on Suicide Funtime's pedestal.

replies.author: freeCodeCamp.org
replies.text:
Ok, we'll try to seek out more woman teachers. Here are a few currently on our channel:
HTML: https://youtu.be/PlxWf493en4
Angular: https://youtu.be/8X_Nmmvobb0
Bash: https://youtu.be/BFMyUgF6I8Y
White board interview: https://youtu.be/51gc7-eskU8
Becoming a better developer: https://youtu.be/mZdznKc5ZaM

Soon we'll be posting more videos from Foo Bar. You can also check out Coding Commander. And if you want to submit your own tutorial to be on the channel, send it to me here: beau@freecodecamp.org.

replies.author: androidgeeking
replies.text: I can point you towards good teachers. I don't assume their gender.

topLevelComment.author: Artistic Arina
topLevelComment.text: Please do a meetup in Punjab,India

replies.author: freeCodeCamp.org
replies.text: According to the freeCodeCamp directory, there are already a few groups in Punjab. Search the directory here: https://study-group-directory.freecodecamp.org/
